title: Union territory
summary: A union territory (Hindi: केन्द्र-शासित प्रदेश, lit. 'centrally administered province') is a type of administrative division in the Republic of India. Unlike the states of India, which have their own governments, union territories are federal territories governed, in part or in whole, by the Union Government of India.[1][2][3] There are currently eight union territories of India.
